name: Tailor Page Builder: Portfolio Extension
author: The Tailor Team

sections.description:
This extension adds portfolio functionality to the Tailor frontend page builder. You can now manage your projects as a separate post type and present them as part of your custom layouts using the powerful new Projects element.

Tailor version 1.7.2 (or newer) must be active to use this extension

To get started with Tailor, refer to our documentation.

You can get in touch with questions or recommendations in a number of ways:

  1. Facebook or Twitter at @tailorwp or @andrewjworsfold.
  2. The Help Center
  3. The GitHub project
  4. The Community Forum

If you like the plugin, you can help by rating it.
sections.installation:
1. Install Tailor

  2. Install the extension via the plugin directory, or by uploading the files manually to your server.

From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’.

  2. Search for ‘Tailor’.

  3. Activate Tailor from your Plugins page. Do the same for the Portfolio extension.

From WordPress.org

  1. Download Tailor and the Portfolio extension.

  2. Upload the ‘tailor’ directory to your ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc..). Do the same for the ‘tailor-portfolio’ directory.

  3. Activate Tailor and the Portfolio extension from your Plugins page.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Install Tailor

  2. Install the extension via the plugin directory, or by uploading the files manually to your server.

From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’.

  2. Search for ‘Tailor’.

  3. Activate Tailor from your Plugins page. Do the same for the Portfolio extension.

From WordPress.org

  1. Download Tailor and the Portfolio extension.

  2. Upload the ‘tailor’ directory to your ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc..). Do the same for the ‘tailor-portfolio’ directory.

  3. Activate Tailor and the Portfolio extension from your Plugins page.

Can I use my existing WordPress theme?

Yes! Tailor (and this extension) works out-of-the-box with nearly every WordPress theme.

Can I include Tailor (and this extension) as part of my theme bundle?

Yes, however, users should be directed to the WordPress plugin repository to install the latest version of the plugin/extension. Consider using a tool like TGM Plugin Activation to guide users through the installation process.
sections.changelog:
1.2.2

  • Added – Added build scripts for developers.
  • Fixed – Projects element lightbox in frontend.

Note: this extension requires Tailor version 1.7.2 (or newer).

1.2.1

  • Added – Responsive settings for the Projects element.

1.2.0

  • Added – Filter for HTML attributes of default elements.
  • Added – Filter for the rendered HTML of default elements.
  • Added – Image link option to the Projects element to align with the Posts element.

1.1.1

  • Added – Filter to modify the rendered HTML of the Projects element.

1.1.0

  • Updated: Compatibility with new and improved Tailor JS API. Please ensure you upgrade to Tailor 1.5.0 or later.

1.0.2

  • Added: Language localization file.
  • Changed: Custom icon for Projects element.

1.0.1

  • Changed: Text domain function with a simple string.

1.0.0

  • Initial release.

short_description: Show off your creative side with this powerful extension for the free Tailor frontend page builder!

upgrade_notice.1.1.0: • This update provides compatibility for the new JS API provided in Tailor 1.5.0. Please ensure that you also upgrade Tailor to at least 1.5.0.

screenshots.caption: Projects element - Display your creative portfolio with the new highly customizable Projects element. Projects are a new custom post type added by the extension.
